Articles.Content: I'm sure thinking it would be cool to have an official (or fan-made unofficial) website that has all the parts in KSP, so that when you don't have the ability to play the game you can just design it there. While I was in school I thought of a spacecraft called Meercat-III (part of my Meercat docking spacecrafts series) and an Ares-II. So it would be cool to see if I can actually make it look the way I wanted.

4 hours ago, Aerodynamic Kerbal said:

I'm sure thinking it would be cool to have an official (or fan-made unofficial) website that has all the parts in KSP, so that when you don't have the ability to play the game you can just design it there. While I was in school I thought of a spacecraft called Meercat-III (part of my Meercat docking spacecrafts series) and an Ares-II. So it would be cool to see if I can actually make it look the way I wanted.

That would be great!
I could design KSP crafts while I am bored in school! Great idea!

3 hours ago, BekfastDerp13 said:

I could design KSP crafts while I am bored in school! Great idea!

Well, during actual classes I suggest you to get a piece of notebook paper and just think - works for me!

20 hours ago, Aerodynamic Kerbal said:

Well, during actual classes I suggest you to get a piece of notebook paper and just think - works for me!

I actually used to do that for my small career save and my sandbox Laythe mission. It was good, but then I got rid of the drawings
This is a pretty sweet idea. For my part I'd use it to design the next vehicle while I wait for my crane to restack my rockets lol.
Being a fan project, I expect the controls for the camera to be a hundred times better than what's in game.
